document.title: An Overview of the Object Browser Hierarchy

toc.envision_title: An Overview of the Object Browser Hierarchy

paragraph.paragraph: The vxurfObjectBrowserS 0 Object Browser window, like the vxurfSolutionExplorerDialog 0 Solution Explorer window, contains projects, at the top-level. The number of EiffelEnvision projects in the vxurfObjectBrowserS 0 Object Browser is directly representative of the number of the same projects contained in the vxurfSolutionExplorerDialog 0 Solution Explorer .
The structure of an EiffelEnvision project in the index.xmlObject Browser adheres to the following hierarchy convention:

Expanding a node that represents an EiffelEnvision project, represented by the ../images/project.ico icon, will always display two child nodes, eiffel_cluster.xmlEiffel Clusters ( ../images/cluster/hier_cluster_all.ico ) and references.xmlReferences ( ../images/assembly/hier_reference_all.ico ). These nodes are a unique additions to the vxurfObjectBrowserS 0 Object Browser , as are require due to the way *Component References are dealt with in EiffelEnvision and the *Eiffel for .NET language.
Note: Expanding an EiffelEnvision project that has not been compiled, or has not compiled information available, will display a the message "System needs to be fully compiled for browsing." EiffelEnvision projects require a project be ../../compiling_projects/index.xmlBuilt before browsing the information contained within the vxurfObjectBrowserS 0 Object Browser .
